solution.text:
The zero of \(_{j}_x+_{j}_\,\) is \(-1\).
Substituting zero of \(g(x)\,\) in \(p(x)\,\), we get,
\(p(-1)=(_{j}_ \times (-1)^2) - (_{j}_ \times (-1)) + _{j}_\)
\(\Rightarrow p(-1)=_{j}_+_{j}_+_{j}_\)
\(\Rightarrow p(-1)=_{{j+j+j}}_\)
Therefore, the remainder when \(p(x)\) is divided by \(g(x)\) is \(_{{j+j+j}}_\)
